name: Did You "C" That in the Bible? Quiz / Test | Religion | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the high priest when Jesus was crucified?
questions.explanation:
Caiaphas.

	Caiaphas was the high priest from 27-36AD. He hated Jesus and did not believe He was the Son of God. In a mock trial at the Sanhedrin, he convinced everyone that Jesus was guilty and ought to suffer the consequences. So, Jesus was sent to Pilate to be sentenced and crucified.

questions.text: Hebrews 11 is known as the "Hall of Faith" by many Christians. According to Hebrews 11:4 Abel offered a better sacrifice to God than whom?
questions.explanation:
Cain.

	In Genesis 4:8 (KJV) Cain killed Abel. He was jealous of his brother because God recognized Abel's gifts more than Cain's. This was because Abel gave the best of what he had and Cain didn't.

questions.text: Who was the Christian named by name in 2 Timothy 4:13 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Carpus.

	Corpus means "fruit, fruitful". He was a Christian from Troas. Troas is the city that Paul started from. The modern name is Eski-Stamboul, which is located in Turkey.

questions.text: David sent someone this place to "greet Nabal by name". Where was he sent?
questions.explanation:
Carmel.

	You can read about the interaction between David and Nabal in 1 Samuel 25. Carmel was located in Judah, in Israel.

questions.text: What spice is mentioned only three times in the Bible: Exodus 10:24, Psalm 41:8 and Ezekiel 27:19 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Cassia.

	Cassia is made from the bark of trees in Eastern Asia. It is the cinnamon that people in North America use.

questions.text: Who was Elidad's father according to Numbers 34:21?
questions.explanation:
Chislon.

	Chislon's name means hopeful or confident. It is pronounced His-lone.

questions.text: According to Luke 8:3, who was Joanna's husband?
questions.explanation:
Chuza.

	Chuza was Herod's steward. Chuza means "the seer or prophet."

questions.text: The first time Cushi is mentioned in the KJV is 2 Samuel 18:21. What does Joab tell him?
questions.correct: Go tell the king what thou hast seen
options: Go tell the king what thou hast heard
Go tell it on the mountain
Go and hide for they want to smite you
questions.explanation:
Go tell the king what thou hast seen.

	In 2 Samuel 2:18:31 Cushi tells the king, "Tidings, my lord the king: for the Lord hath avenged thee this day of all them that rose up against thee." Cushi was short for "the Cushite"; he was Ethiopian.

questions.text: Who was the king of Persia in 2 Chronicles 36:22?
questions.explanation:
Cyrus.

	Cyrus said that God had given him all the land. The Bible says he also put it in writing.
